cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 325 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-southwest, expected to swing west-northwest on Wednesday and then turn northwest/north across the Florida Peninsula toward southern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast between Boca Raton and the Treasure Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to Boca Raton, including Port Everglades
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach Florida to Boca Raton Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and east-central Florida coast, northwestern Bahamas and eventually coastal Georgia–Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with gusts possibly reaching hurricane force as the center passes just north of the port Wednesday night–Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible on the barrier beaches and intracoastal areas around Port Everglades
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches, locally up to 8 inches, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, isolated tornadoes beginning late Wednesday
